class.name: Rect2
class.brief_description: 2D axis-aligned bounding box using floating point coordinates.
class.description: [Rect2] consists of a position, a size, and several utility functions. It is typically used for fast overlap tests. It uses floating-point coordinates. If you need integer coordinates, use [Rect2i] instead. The 3D counterpart to [Rect2] is [AABB]. Negative values for [member size] are not supported and will not work for most methods. Use [method abs] to get a Rect2 with a positive size.

constructor.name: Rect2
constructor.description: Constructs a default-initialized [Rect2] with default (zero) values of [member position] and [member size].

constructor.name: Rect2
constructor.description: Constructs a [Rect2] as a copy of the given [Rect2].

constructor.name: Rect2
constructor.description: Constructs a [Rect2] by position and size.

constructor.name: Rect2
constructor.description: Constructs a [Rect2] by x, y, width, and height.

method.name: abs
method.description: Returns a [Rect2] with equivalent position and area, modified so that the top-left corner is the origin and [code]width[/code] and [code]height[/code] are positive.

method.name: encloses
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Rect2] completely encloses another one.

method.name: expand
get_area
method.description: Returns the area of the [Rect2]. See also [method has_area].

method.name: get_center
method.description: Returns the center of the [Rect2], which is equal to [member position] + ([member size] / 2).

method.name: grow
method.description: Returns a copy of the [Rect2] grown by the specified [param amount] on all sides.

method.name: grow_individual
method.description: Returns a copy of the [Rect2] grown by the specified amount on each side individually.

method.name: grow_side
method.description: Returns a copy of the [Rect2] grown by the specified [param amount] on the specified [enum Side].

method.name: has_area
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [Rect2] has area, and [code]false[/code] if the [Rect2] is linear, empty, or has a negative [member size]. See also [method get_area].

method.name: has_point
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [Rect2] contains a point. By convention, the right and bottom edges of the [Rect2] are considered exclusive, so points on these edges are [b]not[/b] included. [b]Note:[/b] This method is not reliable for [Rect2] with a [i]negative size[/i]. Use [method abs] to get a positive sized equivalent rectangle to check for contained points.

method.name: intersection
method.description: Returns the intersection of this [Rect2] and [param b]. If the rectangles do not intersect, an empty [Rect2] is returned.

method.name: intersects
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the [Rect2] overlaps with [code]b[/code] (i.e. they have at least one point in common). If [param include_borders] is [code]true[/code], they will also be considered overlapping if their borders touch, even without intersection.

method.name: is_equal_approx
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Rect2] and [param rect] are approximately equal, by calling [code]is_equal_approx[/code] on each component.

method.name: is_finite
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this [Rect2] is finite, by calling [method @GlobalScope.is_finite] on each component.

method.name: merge
method.description: Returns a larger [Rect2] that contains this [Rect2] and [param b].

members.member: Ending corner. This is calculated as [code]position + size[/code]. Setting this value will change the size.
Beginning corner. Typically has values lower than [member end].
Size from [member position] to [member end]. Typically, all components are positive. If the size is negative, you can use [method abs] to fix it.

operator.name: operator !=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the rectangles are not equal. [b]Note:[/b] Due to floating-point precision errors, consider using [method is_equal_approx] instead, which is more reliable.

operator.name: operator *
operator.description: Inversely transforms (multiplies) the [Rect2] by the given [Transform2D] transformation matrix.

operator.name: operator ==
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the rectangles are exactly equal. [b]Note:[/b] Due to floating-point precision errors, consider using [method is_equal_approx] instead, which is more reliable.
